# Test Morse Code Decoder Feature

A new morse code decoder has been implemented in Practice Mode. This feature provides real-time decoding of morse code as you key it using paddles or straight key.

## What''s New

- **Adaptive Speed Tracking**: Automatically detects your sending speed (WPM)
- **Real-time Decoding**: Displays decoded text as you key morse code
- **Prosign Support**: Recognizes special prosigns (AR, AS, BK, BT, CT, HH, SK, SN, SOS)
- **Visual WPM Indicator**: Shows detected WPM with color coding (green = matches configured, yellow = different)

## Testing Instructions

### Firmware Update
Updated firmware with the decoder feature is available at: **https://update.vailadapter.com**

### How to Test

1. **Enter Practice Mode**: Main Menu → Training → Practice
2. **Enable Decoder**: Press **D** key to toggle decoder on/off
3. **Key Some Morse Code**: Use your iambic paddle or straight key

### What to Test

#### Basic Character Decoding
- [ ] Send individual letters (A-Z) - verify they decode correctly
- [ ] Send numbers (0-9) - verify they decode correctly
- [ ] Send punctuation (. , ? / etc.) - verify they decode correctly
- [ ] Mix fast and slow sending - decoder should adapt

#### WPM Detection
- [ ] Verify WPM display appears in green when sending at configured speed
- [ ] Verify WPM display turns yellow when sending faster/slower
- [ ] Try different speeds (10 WPM, 15 WPM, 20 WPM) - decoder should track

#### Prosign Support
Send these prosigns **without pauses between elements**:
- [ ] AR (\`.-.-.\`) - Should display \`<AR>\`
- [ ] SK (\`...-.-\`) - Should display \`<SK>\`
- [ ] BK (\`-...-.-\`) - Should display \`<BK>\`
- [ ] BT (\`-...-\`) - Should display \`<BT>\`
- [ ] AS (\`.-...\`) - Should display \`<AS>\`
- [ ] SOS (\`...---...\`) - Should display \`<SOS>\`
- [ ] HH (\`........\`) - 8 dits, should display \`<HH>\`

#### Word Spacing
- [ ] Send multiple characters with normal spacing - should decode as continuous text
- [ ] Leave longer pauses between words - should add spaces between words
- [ ] Send a complete sentence - verify proper word spacing

#### Edge Cases
- [ ] Very fast sending (30+ WPM) - should still decode
- [ ] Very slow sending (5-10 WPM) - should still decode
- [ ] Inconsistent spacing - decoder should adapt
- [ ] Toggle decoder off/on - state should reset properly

## Expected Behavior

**UI Layout:**
\`\`\`
Speed: 20 WPM -> 18.5 WPM  (color coded)
Tone: 700 Hz

Decoded Text:
THE QUICK BROWN FOX <AR>
JUMPS OVER THE LAZY DOG
<SK>
\`\`\`

**Decoder Features:**
- Characters appear in real-time as you key them
- Detected WPM updates continuously
- Word spacing automatically detected (7-dit gaps)
- Prosigns displayed with angle brackets \`<AR>\`

## Known Limitations

- Decoder optimized for reasonably clean sending
- Extreme timing jitter may cause occasional misreads
- Very fast code (40+ WPM) may have reduced accuracy

## Reporting Issues

Please report any problems with:
- Which characters decode incorrectly
- What WPM speed you were sending at
- Whether using iambic or straight key
- Screenshots if possible

## Technical Details

**Algorithm**: Based on morse-pro adaptive decoder by Stephen C Phillips
- Weighted averaging of last 30 timing samples
- Auto-adjusting dit/dah thresholds
- Farnsworth timing support
- License: EUPL v1.2

**Implementation Files** (for reference):
- \`morse_wpm.h\` - WPM timing utilities
- \`morse_decoder.h\` - Base decoder class
- \`morse_decoder_adaptive.h\` - Adaptive speed tracking
- \`training_practice.h\` - Integration into practice mode

---

**Status**: Ready for testing - firmware available at update.vailadapter.com
EOF
)")
